publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-131 Pauline McNeill: Showcasing of Young Bands in Glasgow—That the Parliament welcomes the comments made by Oasis musician Noel Gallagher that one of his best ever nights out was in Partick, Glasgow; notes that his musical career was launched in Glasgow after the band was signed to Creation Records following a gig in the city's King Tut's venue; further notes the increasing difficulties faced by young bands in Glasgow and throughout Scotland in getting gigs and a breakthrough in the music industry, and calls on Noel Gallagher to return to Partick to host a showcase event for young Glasgow talent.

S2M-131 Pauline McNeill: Showcasing of Young Bands in Glasgow—That the Parliament welcomes the comments made by Oasis musician Noel Gallagher that one of his best ever nights out was in Partick, Glasgow; notes that his musical career was launched in Glasgow after the band was signed to Creation Records following a gig in the city's King Tut's venue; further notes the increasing difficulties faced by young bands in Glasgow and throughout Scotland in getting gigs and a breakthrough in the music industry, and calls on Noel Gallagher to return to Partick to host a showcase event for young Glasgow talent.
S2M-131 Showcasing of Young Bands in Glasgow (lodged on 11 June 2003) Donald Gorrie*
